alert.note: Alert for Alger; Luce; Marquette; Northern Schoolcraft; Southern Schoolcraft (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 23 at 4:24AM EST until December 24 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations today through Saturday night of 10 to 20 inches, greatest east of Marquette. Snow amounts will taper dramatically across Marquette County with only 1 to 3 inches expected south of Gwinn. Winds gusting to as high as 55 to 65 mph near the Lake Superior shore. Inland, winds will gust to 40 to 50 mph. * WHERE...Marquette, Alger, Luce, Southern Schoolcraft and Northern Schoolcraft Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility, frequently to near zero, especially east of Marquette. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and cause power outages.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Alger; Luce; Marquette; Northern Schoolcraft; Southern Schoolcraft
